intro: Galium schultesii var. nikolicii, commonly known as the Nikolic's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the genus Galium, with specific adaptations to its native habitat.
